data.title: Robert Hensley (abt.1759-aft.1855)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Robert Hensley born abt. 1759 Bucks, Pennsylvania died 1855 Roane, Tennessee, United States including research + descendants + 2 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

[spouse(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 4 Feb 2024 | Created 27 Feb 2011

This page has been accessed 735 times.

Biography

Only two proven children are known to Robert,the rest are speculation, including Anne Hensley. Anne was from Hawkins Co,TN as was Robert Hensley and both move to Roane Co, TN about the same time. Roberts son Benjamin, proven, shared custody two of Roberts SR, grandchildren, that were listed with him on 1850 census. Listed birth place as Pennsylvania on Rev War pension application, 1850 census says birth place was North Carolina, Virginia is listed , as he may be the unproven son of Benjamin Hensley b 1730 and Elizabeth of VA and later of NC.

Research Notes

[page 3 of 8 pages (all in script):]

1

[curly bracket begins] State of Tennessee Hawkins County [end curly bracket] On the 1st day of April in the year one thousand eight hundred and thirty four personally appear before the circuit court for the county and state aforesaid at the March term of said court 1834 Robert Hensley [sic] of the county of Hawkins and the state aforesaid and saith that he was born on the 29th day of Feby 1759 it being leap [insert caret] year in the county of Bucks in the state of Pennsylvania as he was informed making him at this time aged about seventy five years and further that he has lost the records of his age and has none now in his papers. [? none]. Being first duly sworn according to law, Doth on his oat make the following Declaration in the act of Congress passed the7th June 1832: That he volunteered under the immediate command of Captain George Maxwell of Tghe County of Sullivan in the Regiment commanded by Colonel Isaac Shelby and was in the Service of the United States for the term of six months during the revolutionary war, that he was in the battle of Kings Mountain when Col. Ferguson was defeated[?.] after the battle with the American troops to Salisbury with the prisoners in charge, after the expiration of his six months service as a volunteer in Co. Shelbys Regt he substituted in place of Dyer Hudson into a company of Militia commanded by Captain William Cloud in the county of Stokes in the State of North Carolina, on or about the 1st of May 1781, for the term of six months, from which place he was march [sic] in Col Hughes regiment to broad river on or near the line between North and South Carolina, http://freepages.rootsweb.com/~harrimantn/genealogy/giles/Revolutionary%20War%20service%20record%20for%20Robert%20HANSLEY%20of%20Hawkins%20County,%20Tennessee%20(North%20Carolina%20service).htm

Sources

Transcription of the Revolutionary War service record for Robert HANSLEY of Hawkins County, Tennessee (North Carolina service) NARA S4323, Record transcribed by Dawnelle Giles Loiselle, a 4th great-granddaughter,Transcription format and notes copyright 2004-2007 D Giles Loiselle File updated (with birth month amendedation in the transcript): 8 Mar 2007.

1850 United States Federal Census Benjamin Hensley Name: Benjamin Hensley Age: 53 Birth Year: abt 1797 Birthplace: Tennessee Home in 1850: Subdivision 20, Roane, Tennessee, USA Gender: Male Family Number: 251 Household Members: Name Age Benjamin Hensley 53 Mary Hensley 53 Nancy Hensley 21 Marshall G Hensley 18

Name: Robert Hensley Age: 98 Birth Year: abt 1752 Birthplace: North Carolina Home in 1850: Subdivision 20, Roane, Tennessee, USA Gender: Male Family Number: 252 Household Members: Name Age Robert Hensley 98 Benjamin F Hensley 7 Samuel Hensley 5 1850 ROANE CO, TN Page 339 House/Family # 241/ 251] HENSLEY Benjamin 53 [ b abt 1796] 53 no occupa, b TN HENSLEY Mary 53 [ b abt 1796] b North Carolina, cannot read & write HENSLEY Nancy 21[ b abt 1828] b tn, cannot read & write HENSLEY Marshall G 18 [ b abt1831]18 b tn Although Robert HENSLEY is the next family ennumerated in this census,the census indicates that he resides in the same house as Benjamin:
